medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient initially presented at 34 years of age with bilateral lower-extremity weakness. After surgery, the patient experienced shortness of breath and left upper-extremity weakness, including weakness in the hand and loss of sensation in the thumb. Over a 5-year period, there was progressive recurrence of the meningioma despite multiple regimens of chemotherapy and radiotherapy.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The medical history was otherwise unremarkable.
medical_history.family_history: No family history of cancer or neurogenetic diseases; parents and sibling were in good health.
